metadata.title: CVE-2020-35518 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
When binding against a DN during authentication, the reply from 389-ds-basewill be different whether the DN exists or not. This can be used by anunauthenticated attacker to check the existence of an entry in the LDAPdatabase.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 2.0.2
389-ds-base - 2.0.2
389-ds-base-libs - 2.0.2
cockpit-389-ds - 2.0.2
python3-lib389 - 2.0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2').
